publication.title: A Surface Reconstruction Method for Highly Noisy Point Clouds
publication.jconf: Variational, Geometric, and Level Set Methods in Computer Vision
publication.keyword: Geometric Feature;Minimal Surface;Point Cloud;Surface Reconstruction;Level Set Method;
publication.abstract: In this paper we propose a surface reconstruction method for highly noisy and non-uniform data based on minimal surface model and tensor voting method. To deal with ill-posedness, noise and/or other uncertainties in the data we processes the raw data rst using tensor voting before we do surface reconstruction. The tensor voting procedure allows more global and robust communications among

publication.title: Convergence of the simultaneous algebraic reconstruction technique (SART)
publication.keyword: Algebraic Reconstruction Technique;Image Reconstruction;Weighted Least Square;Simultaneous Algebraic Reconstruction Technique;
publication.abstract: In 198~, the simultaneous algebraic reconstruction technique (SART) was developed as a major refinement of the algebraic reconstruction technique (ART). Since then, the SART approach remains a powerful tool for iterative image reconstruction. However, the conver- gence of the SART has never been established. In this paper, this long-standing conjecture is proven under the condition that coeffficients of the linear

publication.abstract: The temporal bone is a complex paired set of struc- tures at the skull base which contains the organ of hear- ing among others (1). Treatment of severe to profound, bilateral hearing loss often employs a multi-electrode cochlear implant inserted into the inner ear part of the temporal bone. CT scanners cannot resolve many im- portant temporal bone details, especially

publication.title: An Optimized Two-Step Solution for Updating XML Views
publication.abstract: View updating is a long standing difficult problem. Given a vi ew defined over base data sources and a view update, there are several different updates over the base data sources, called translations, that perform the update. A translation is said to be correct if it performs the update and at the same time does not update any portion of

publication.title: Updating Views Over Recursive XML
publication.abstract: We study the problem of updating XML views defined over XML documents. A view update is performed by finding the base updates over the underlying data sources that achieve the desired view update. If such base updates do not exist, the view update is said to be untranslatable and rejected. In SQL, determining whether a view update is translatable is

publication.title: HUX: Handling Updates in XML
publication.keyword: Data Model;Education System;web-based system;Protein Information Resource;Worcester Polytechnic Institute;
publication.abstract: We demonstrate HUX (Handling Updates in XML) which provides a reliable and efficient solution for the XML view update prob- lem. Given an update over an XML view, our U-Filter subsytem first determines whether the update is translatable or not by exam- ining potential conflicts in both schema and data. If an update is determined to be translatable, our U-Translator

publication.title: Enhancement of Microtubules In EM Tomography
publication.jconf: IEEE International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging
publication.keyword: 3d imaging;Image Enhancement;Noise Removal;Structure Analysis;Volume Data;Wavelet Transform;
publication.abstract: The interpretation of the EM tomography of microtubules is challenging due to the low SNR and low contrast of the volume data. Therefore, image enhancement is crucial for the subsequent segmentation and structural analysis of mi- crotubules. In this paper, We propose a model based 3D image enhancement approach by combining transform do- main technique and spatial domain techniques in

publication.keyword: Active Shape Model;Electron Tomography;Feature Detection;High Resolution;Image Enhancement;Indexing Terms;Wavelet Transform;
publication.abstract: Kinetochore microtubules (KMTs) and the associated plus-ends have been areas of intense investigation in both cell bi- ology and molecular medicine. Though electron tomography opens up new possibilities in understanding their function by imaging their high-resolution structures, the interpretation of the acquired data remains an obstacle because of the complex and cluttered cellular environment. As a result, practical segmentation of

publication.keyword: computational uid dynamics;Molecular Dynamic;Numerical Simulation;Scientific Data;
publication.abstract: Numerical simulation is replacing experimentation as a means to gain insight into complex physical phenom- ena. Analyzing the data produced by such simulations is extremely challenging, given the enormous sizes of the datasets involved. In order to make ecient progress, analyzing such data must advance from current techniques that only visualize static images of the data, to novel techniques that

publication.title: Geometric Verification of Features in Flow Fields
publication.abstract: In this paper, we present a verification algorithm for swirling featuresin flow fields, based on the geometry of streamlines. The featuresof interest in this case are vortices. Without a formal definition,existing detection algorithms lack the ability to accuratelyidentify these features, and the current method for verifying theaccuracy of their results is by human visual inspection. Our verificationalgorithm addresses this issue

publication.title: Spatial Domain Wavelet Design for Feature Preservation in Computational Data Sets
publication.jconf: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
publication.keyword: Computation Fluid Dynamics;Feature Preservation;Filter Design;Frequency Domain;Large Data Sets;Scientific Data;Low Pass Filter;Wavelet Transform;
publication.abstract: High-fidelity wavelet transforms can facilitate visualization and analysis of large scientific data sets. However, it is important that salient characteristics of the original features be preserved under the transformation. We present a set of filter design axioms in the spatial domain which ensure that certain feature characteristics are preserved from scale to scale and that the resulting filters correspond to

publication.title: Vortex Visualization for Practical Engineering Applications
publication.jconf: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
publication.keyword: Computation Fluid Dynamics;Flow Field;Indexing Terms;k-means clustering;Large Data Sets;Scalar Field;Unstructured Mesh;Visual Features;Visualization Technique;
publication.abstract: In order to understand complex vortical flows in large data sets, we must be able to detect and visualize vortices in an automated fashion. In this paper, we present a feature-based vortex detection and visualization technique that is appropriate for large computational fluid dynamics data sets computed on unstructured meshes. In particular, we focus on the application of this technique

publication.title: Quantitative steganalysis of binary images
publication.authors: nasir d. memon,edward k. wong,xiaolin wu
publication.abstract: We propose a quantitative steganalysis method to detect hidden information embedded by ipping pixels along boundaries in bi- nary images. We model steganographic embedding as an additive noise process and use compression rate as a distinguishing statis- tic that aids in discriminating between stego-images and cover- images. We specically use the JBIG 2 binary image compression algorithm to derive a

publication.title: Steganalysis of boundary-based steganography using autoregressive model of digital boundaries
publication.jconf: International Conference on Multimedia Computing and Systems/International Conference on Multimedia and Expo
publication.abstract: In this paper, we present a novel technique for the steganalysis of digital documents, when the secret message is embedded along the boundaries of text characters or other symbols in the documents. The proposed technique uses an auto-regressive model to detect marked documents, as well as to estimate the relative length of the embedded messages. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness
